intro: Chiritopsis, commonly known as the "silverleaf" or "buttercup flower," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in rocky or sandy soils. They are characterized by their small, daisy-like flowers and silver or gray-green foliage, which helps reduce water loss. Chiritopsis species are often used in xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and ornamental value. The genus includes several species, some of which are native to North America and the Mediterranean region.
